title: Champions League Quarter - Finals ; 2nd Leg
body_text:
Champions League ‚Äî Quarter-Finals; 2nd Leg
The final battles for the last 8 in the Champions League ‚Äî 2nd Leg ties‚Ä¶
Tuesday 15 April 2025
20:00 Aston Villa v PSG ‚Äî Amazon Prime Video
20:00 Borussia Dortmund v Barcelona ‚Äî TNT Sports 1
Wednesday 16 April 2025
20:00 Inter Milan v Bayern Munich ‚Äî TNT Sports 2
20:00 Real Madrid v Arsenal ‚Äî TNT Sports 1
Note: the following content is not moderated or vetted by the site owners at the time of submission. Comments are the responsibility of the poster. Disclaimer ()
Posted
15/04/2025 at
21:34:46
Quite the comeback for Villa ‚Äî surely dead and buried at 1-5 on aggregate after 30 minutes.
Now 4-5 on aggregate and another goal needed with 15 minutes left.
Posted
15/04/2025 at
21:37:17
I didn't see it happening, Michael.
I still reckon they'll fall short.
Posted
15/04/2025 at
21:40:45
I'm torn here. I should want Villa to do it and would be made up for them.
But the footballing purist in me likes this PSG team.
Posted
15/04/2025 at
21:42:58
Amazing how far Villa have come, Danny.
What did they do that we didn't or couldn't?
Posted
15/04/2025 at
21:47:02
Magnificent effort by Villa - brilliant game.
Posted
15/04/2025 at
21:52:03
I've no idea Julian. Similar sized club, similar history. Similar support base.
Got relegated twice in my lifetime, but came back.
An example that anything is possible no matter how bad it gets.
Unlucky Villa. Gave it a real go. I'll go and console the inlaws.
Posted
15/04/2025 at
22:03:57
So now I hope Arsenal win the Champions League.
Posted
15/04/2025 at
22:19:36
Further contemplating that, win, lose or draw, all any supporter wants is for their team to compete and give it a go, even when the odds are stacked against.
Villa have done that over both legs against arguably the best team in Europe at the moment. No sitting back and hoping for the best. They went for it.
I still think it will be a PSG v Barcelona final, the dream final if you like. But then quite often, those type of matches fail to live up to the hype and expectation.
Posted
15/04/2025 at
22:46:35
Football at its finest and although I would also describe myself as a purist Danny, I don‚Äôt see anything wrong with the way Aston Villa, currently play the beautiful game.
I remember being on holiday not long before covid, and Villa, who had just been promoted, turned Everton over two nil, by playing with the type of honest endeavour,that you expect from a newly promoted team.
They played with that same honest endeavour tonight but they have now added a lot of genuine quality and were actually very unlucky against arguably the most fluent team in the competition tonight.
I hope they win the FA Cup, and it actually wouldn‚Äôt surprise me to see them fighting for the premier league next season, if they can become a more consistent outfit.
Posted
15/04/2025 at
22:49:45
Villa relegated 4 times in my lifetime, Danny!
The tricksy quiz question element is that not all those relegations were from top flight to second flight.
Posted
16/04/2025 at
03:19:00
On the CBS Sports Champions League postgame, Miles the Everton fan was sparring with Carragher about the rumor of Paul McCartney singing at Goodison on the last day.
Is there really any reporting on that? Anybody?
Posted
16/04/2025 at
06:12:41
Donnaruma, what a display.
Posted
16/04/2025 at
06:19:36
I think John McGinn, a player I've always liked, epitomises what you say about Villa Tony.
Mike, I've heard the rumours about McCartney, but they are just that. Whatever the club has planned, they will need to confirm and announce soon.
I'm not so sure about McCartney or his Everton credentials. I did once read his dad used to go regularly and sit in the Upper Bullens.
I think Sir Paul and the rest of the Beatles were not really into football. He says he is Everton because of his family and that if it came down to it in a derby, he would have to side with Everton. Mmmm!!
We have options if the performer(s) have to be from Liverpool and have Evertonian connections. Atomic Kitten?!!!!! Or maybe 90s indie band the La's they have a least one in their ranks.
Here's an article from the Echo earlier this year. There are some surprises in there. John Travolta??
Link
Posted
16/04/2025 at
06:41:53
Danny, Atomic Kitten, please. No chance of the La's, no chance. You're talking about Lee Mavers mate, diehard blue, ST. There's more chance of getting me, Sean Kearns, Paul Kossof, and Barry Rathbone in a room than the La's.
Two more possibilities mate. The lead singer of Yank band Future Islands is a massive blue but well clock the dancing and he sings like Dyche - minute 2.23 is magical. Pure 100 per cent Dyche-sing.
https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=upPl9mZW_zw
And, then, the name of the bassist in this Buggles wannabe group in beard and shades is Tony Hibbert. Best to go full screen for volume control. The keyboard player is the biggest twat in the history of TOTP
https://www.facebook.com/watch/?v=322584591975464
Posted
16/04/2025 at
07:13:40
Atomic Kitten was tongue in cheek Paul when I saw them on the Echo's list. I do remember her being pictured in an Everton top.
That Future Islands track sounded good. Thanks for the introduction. That lead singer must be a blue. He is proper getting down with his bad self as if he's in the Winslow after watching Everton win!!
Is that bassist. Is his name Tony Hibbert or is it Tony Hibbert wearing a cunning disguise?!! He could cause a riot!!
Posted
16/04/2025 at
07:30:44
Liz is a massive blue Danny from a massive blue family. She's often said family and Everton are the greatest loves of her life mate. Like you, in fact, plus your brothers in arms.
Posted
16/04/2025 at
09:53:04
McGinn, doesn‚Äôt mind leaving it in Danny, just like a lot of players don‚Äôt mind feigning injury. I sometimes wonder what is worse, although I know what most people will say.
If McCartney is playing the last game then I can see the price of tickets going enormously through the roof, and although I‚Äôve never heard a worse live performer, I‚Äôm certain Dylan, has got to be an Evertonian!
Atomic Kitten might not be a bad shout if they can make us whole againü§¶‚ôÇÔ∏è

He‚Äôs been a great manager Carlo, and it must have been a pleasure to play for a manager that seems to give his players a lot more Carte-Blanche, than most top level managers, but sometimes a team need a few more ideas, than Madrid produced tonight.
Sometimes I think the total opposite with regards Arteta, when I watch Arsenal, and feel that they could be a lot more productive if he would just loosen the reins a little bit, but not tonight because they were exceptional with regards their defensive shape and discipline, and this gave the platform for a richly deserved victoryüëèüëè

That was an observation of Rice when we recently played Arsenal. He was playing in a very reserved position, whereas he offers a lot when given freedom to drive forward.
I admit to having my doubts about Arteta when he took the plunge to take up the Arsenal job as his first step into management. But he served a good apprenticeship under Guardiola and I'm sure he learned a lot from Wenger.
Much talk of PSG, Barcelona and Arsenal. Inter leading Serie A with Napoli the closest to them (3 points). I haven't seen them play, but Italians are usually made for competitions like this and the World Cup, characterised by defensive masterclasses.

Well done Arsenal, I never liked them much (well they aren't Everton are they?) but since Mikel went there who is my all time favourite player, I always look out for them. I am actually drinking coffee from my Arteta Everton mug right now as I type this, bit faded now.
They are perennial chokers in the PL but they have surprised me in the Champions League this season. That 2nd half against Real in the first leg was one of the finest 45mins of footie I have seen in many years, superb. Rice is an absolute baller.
They are reportedly looking at Williams of Bilbao in the summer along with Gyokeres or Jonathan David. If they can pull off both of those signings they might actually win the PL next season.
